entry.title: Roseburg Man Dies in Single-Vehicle Crash Near Dillard
entry.summary: A 65-year-old Roseburg man, David Knott, died Monday evening after a single-vehicle crash on Old Highway 99 South near Dillard. His vehicle left the road and bystanders attempted CPR, but he was pronounced dead at the scene. The crash remains under investigation.

entry.title: ROSEBURG TO SEE HIGHS 10 TO 15 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH WEDNESDAY
entry.summary: September 23, 2025 3:50 a.m. Roseburg will see high temperatures that are 10 to 15 degrees above normal for Tuesday and Wednesday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that strong high pressure is centered over much of southern Oregon. While the temperatures will be higher...

entry.title: FIRE DANGER LEVEL INCREASES TO HIGH
entry.summary: September 23, 2025 3:40 a.m. Due to the forecast of increased, above-normal temperatures, decreased relative humidity and reduced overnight moisture recovery, the Douglas Forest Protective Association has increased the fire danger level to HIGH, effective Tuesday. DFPA Public Information Officer Rachel Pope said this applies to all private, county, state, and Bureau of Indian Affairs...

entry.title: PINE STREET WATER MAIN REPLACEMENT PROJECT CONTINUES
entry.summary: September 23, 2025 3:30 a.m. A water-main replacement project continues along Southeast Pine Street between Southeast Oak Avenue and Southeast Sykes Avenue in Roseburg. A city release said the project is replacing about 2,600 linear feet of 6-inch-water main installed in the 1930s with new 8-inch-diameter water main. Work also includes mid-block replacements on Southeast...

Residential yard waste is the only material that may be burned. Prohibited items include standing berry vines,...

entry.title: ROSEBURG VA WITH FREE FLU SHOTS AVAILABLE

entry.title: COMMUNITY INVITED TO EXPERIENCE POVERTY SIMULATION IN ROSEBURG

entry.title: DFPA Raises Fire Danger Level to High Starting Sept. 23
entry.summary: DFPA will raise fire danger to HIGH on Sept. 23. Public Use Restrictions increase: power saws, mowing cured grass, welding, and metal cutting are only allowed before 10 a.m. or after 8 p.m. Industrial Fire Precaution Level remains at IFPL II.

entry.title: Roseburg Fire Department to Issue Residential Burn Permits in October
entry.summary: Roseburg Fire Department will issue residential burn permits Oct. 1–31. Permits cost $75, valid for 7 days, and allow yard waste only. Fires must be attended, out before dark, and burn barrels are banned. Apply weekdays at 541-492-6770 or online at cityofroseburg.org/departments/fire/burn-permits.

entry.title: The Confluence Art Show & Sale returns to Roseburg
entry.summary: One of the most common subjects in art is natural landscapes, often due to their inherent visual appeal. This weekend, artists get a chance to directly immerse themselves in a landscape not to create art, but to sell it.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 9.22.25
entry.summary: Nick Smith of the American Forest Resource Council talks about the Roadless Rule and why he organization wants to see it rescinded.

entry.title: Roseburg City Council to Consider Fireworks Ban, Urban Campground Proposal
entry.summary: Roseburg City Council meets tonight, Sept. 22, at 7 p.m. to consider buying a 2.56-acre site on S.E. Stephens St. for use as an urban campground and discussing a possible citywide fireworks ban over fire safety concerns. Public comments are welcome in person, by email, or via Zoom.

entry.title: Siskyou Mountain Film Tour screening in Roseburg celebrates public land maintenance
entry.summary: If documentary filmmaking possesses one core strength, is is that it can be deeply personal, highlighting the lives and experiences of its subjects in real time with a raw sense of authenticity.

entry.title: Roseburg Elks host Auto Extravaganza at Umpqua Community College
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — Elvis Hunsaker sat in front is his 1955 Oldsmobile Rocket 88 and handed out small American flags, even offering two sizes to choose from, to everyone who wanted one.

entry.title: CommunityUnity joins in hosting Winston Dillard Melon Festival
entry.summary: WINSTON — Saturday's warm skies welcomed people outside and to the Winston Dillard Melon Festival in Riverbend Park in Winston. People arrived in droves following the parade at 10 a.m. to play games, watch the entertainment and eat fair food…

entry.title: AFRC AND CALFORESTS URGE FOREST SERVICE TO RESCIND THE ROADLESS RULE
entry.summary: September 22, 2025 2:50 a.m. Late last week, the American Forest Resource Council and California the Forestry Association submitted formal comments to the U.S. Forest Service in support of rescinding the 2001 Roadless Area Conversation Rule. The two associations, representing forest products manufacturers and forest land stewards across the West, say the nationwide, top-down rule...

entry.summary: The Summer Reading Program may be over, but Roseburg Public Library still is basking in the glow of an amazing 12 weeks of special activities and reading fun for all ages.

entry.title: Ask a Master Gardener: Shasta daisies (copy)
entry.summary: Question: My neighbor has this bush that is covered in beautiful large flowers. I thought it was a hibiscus but she said it’s called the Rose of Sharon. Which one of us is right, and can you tell me more…

entry.title: After nearly 2 decades, Winston's Now N Then Antique Mall is closing for good
entry.summary: Eclectic doesn't even begin to describe it: Baseball cards, VHS tapes, heirloom china cabinets, Transformers action figures, vintage pottery, 19th century weapons of war, family photos of long-departed strangers.
